subject: History
title: The Marshall Plan Rebuilds Europe
description: A fast breakdown of The Marshall Plan Rebuilds Europe for builders.

hook.text: America spent $13 billion rebuilding the continent it just bombed. It was the most generous act in geopolitical history.

buildup.text: By 1947, Europe was starving. Factories were rubble. Millions were homeless. Communism was gaining ground.

discovery.text: Secretary Marshall proposed massive economic aid to rebuild Europeâ€”including former enemies Germany and Italy.

twist.text: The plan wasn't purely generousâ€”it was strategic. A prosperous Europe would buy American goods and resist communism.

climax.text: Within four years, Western European economies grew 35%. The Marshall Plan helped create modern European prosperity.

punchline.text: The best defense against communism turned out to be prosperity.

quiz.question: What was the strategic motivation behind America's Marshall Plan?
options: To punish Germany by controlling its economy
To create a prosperous Europe that would resist Soviet influence and buy American goods
To establish American military bases across Europe
